text:
March 29
1967
Senator Abraham Ribicoff
Room 232
Old Senate Office Building
Washington, D. C.
Dear Senator Ribicoff*
Please accept my appreciation for the time expended by
Mr. James Dorsch, your Legislative Assistant.
His courteous and considerate attention to the discussion
of the role of radio within the Public Television Act
punctuated by his very appropriate questions created a
sincere feeling that, at least for this individual, the
visit was mutually worthwhile. It should provide you
with information and certainly did provide me with increased
enthusiasm and encouragement.
Again, many thanks.
Sincerely,
Albert P. Fredette
Manager and Coordinator
of Communications
APFlBA
cc* Mr. James Dorsch
